Job Purpose/Summary

This Finance Business Analyst (Business Analyst) position is a skilled entry level position that will work closely within a cross-functional/cross-business unit team as well as throughout Celink’s organization hierarchy and with consultants. This role is highly collaborative and is equally technical as operational. The Business Analyst will help analyze business processes and data to support the Finance systems transformation roadmap. The Business Analyst’s area of focus will include documenting current state/future state workflows; data collection, cleansing and mapping to future state systems; development of future state draft policy & procedures; and supporting configuration and use of future state NetSuite reporting tools. The business analyst will support the identification of areas for change management throughout the transformation.




Duties and responsibilities

Understand data process inputs and outputs across the entire lifecycle of Finance business processes.
Document current state business process and data workflows by collaborating with key process participants.
Work collaboratively to identify change management for the transition to and optimization of future-state system configurations.
Support system transformation implementation data needs i.e., downloading, cleansing, mapping.
Draft business workflows and written procedures and policies by collaborating with key process participants for approval by Finance leadership and/or business management.
Support Accounting with financial reporting utilizing various data sources and NetSuite tools.
Develop and maintain a close working relationship with key process participants.
Support Finance special projects needs as requested.

Qualifications




Education

Bachelor’s degree in business, Finance, Information Systems, Computer Science, Project Management, or other relevant area.




Experience/Training

0-2 years of relevant experience OR equivalent combination of education and relevant experience. Prior experience in the mortgage industry and/or NetSuite is preferred, but not required.

Preferred candidates will have a strong background in roles that are highly analytical and working with business processes and large data sets efficiently.




Professional Certification/License

None required




Skills and Abilities




Understanding of workflows, operational process design, control, and improvement
Experience working with large data sets and data visualization.
Proficient in MS Excel; Lucid Chart and/or other data visualization tools
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to effectively present information and respond to questions in both one-on-one situations and group meetings.
A desire to understand Celink’s business processes.
Prior exposure to the mortgage servicing industry is a plus, but not required.
Prior exposure to NetSuite is a plus, but not required.



Working Conditions




Work is performed predominately remote, but some travel may be required. There may be some travel with overnight stays. This role routinely uses standard office equipment and video conferencing applications.




Physical Requirements




While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to: talk or hear; to use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms.




Other Duties




Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.




EEO Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Job Title: Sr Business Analyst- Tax Technology Automation
Job Description:
Dematic is seeking a Senior Business Analyst, focused on US and Canadian tax technology integration and automation. This role is a key member of our core tax team providing automation and technology guidance and enhancements with an emphasis primarily on US and Canadian indirect taxes for a complex industry. Reporting to the Director of Tax, the candidate will be leading the creation, implementation, and maintenance of tax technology tools and process improvements, system automation, and data analytics. This role will assist in improving the effectiveness and efficiency of existing tax processes as well as developing more effective future processes with the expected implementation of SAP S4/HANA.

The successful candidate should have 4-7 years of experience in tax in a corporate setting and/or Public Accounting with a focus on tax technology. The candidate should also be comfortable communicating at a professional level, as well as taking a hands-on approach to their daily responsibilities.

This is What You Will do in This Role:

Represents the tax department and acts as the primary liaison with other business functional departments, IT and the Business Transformation (S4/HANA) team.
Leads process to provide support and/or identify tax technology needs and partners with IT to provide relevant options.
Provides technical knowledge in the design (e.g. tax data requirements), development, implementation, maintenance, and support of enterprise tax systems.
Implements and maintains tax automation and reporting tools as well as new system enhancements by gathering and documenting business requirements and partnering with IT to identify and test.
Partners with others to understand and create specific business requirement documents, system configuration documents, test plans and test cases, user training documents and communications to users.
Assesses, documents, and improves processes and data flows related to tax.
Stays informed on emerging tax technologies.
Provides training where needed on all utilized technology tools & resources.
Aids in software design and development that is sustainable, supportable and scalable.
Interacts with Dematic associates, customers, tax advisors, state and local Departments of Revenue, and state and local assessors to resolve issues and maintain relationships
Assists Director of Tax where needed on special projects, sales tax audits, etc.

What We are Looking For:

BS/BA in Accounting, finance, or computer science relevant field
At least 4-7 years of experience in related field, demonstrating successful execution of key responsibilities and knowledge as presented above
US and Canadian indirect tax experience (including audit/controversy experience) preferred (sales and use taxes / GST)
Proficient understanding of data extract / transform / load (ETL) tools
Prior experience in tax technology, including implementation and maintenance of automated tax systems
Experience in developing process documentation as well as gathering/documenting requirements and participating in end user acceptance testing
Ability to balance multiple demands with a strong sense of urgency and prioritization
Strong analytical and deductive reasoning skills
Strong communication skills
Advanced Excel/Microsoft Office tools skills required
Experience with SAP and indirect tax software such as SOVOS Global Tax Determination
Experience implementing financial systems such as SAP S4/HANA
Experience leading project management or financial process improvement.
Experience working with third parties including services providers, auditors, and/or consultants.

The Business Systems Analyst III will serve as a senior Enterprise Application Engineering team member and deliver projects and end-user support with best-in-class methodology, which may include guiding more entry-level engineers.

Understand customer requirements and how they translate into application features.

International Trade Services (ITS) Business Support Specialist
The International Trade Services Business Support Specialist is responsible to provide Letters of Credit process and systems support to commercial and retail clients and customers. This position will assist clients, Lending & Trade Services Operations, and the Commercial Lending and Wealth Management divisions of the Bank with process and system training to new and existing customers, serve as an IT liaison for escalation of system related issues, monitor workflow queues and provide customer support and resolution for system related issues reported on the letters of credit portfolio for the benefit of all designated business lines, credit teams and external customers. In addition, this position is responsible for creating process and system training documentation, perform user acceptance testing, draft business requirements as well as, provides subject matter expertise to enterprise and functional area projects.

Position Responsibilities:

Service Effectiveness and Delivery
Support day to day activities to achieve Technology and Operations Targets.
Perform all activities for metrics and operational performance, report and analyze, review and resolve trends in quality issues, and coordinate implementation of process changes to improve quality and production.
Serves as primary point person for key projects and system enhancements for the systems utilized by the Trade and Letters of Credit Operations and develop and maintain project plans for assigned projects.
Act as Internal liaison/point person with other departments for designated business line to support all system enhancements or issues.
Support process improvement initiatives and activities to advance service ownership through volunteering or as assigned by providing subject matter expertise and assisting in preparing any documentation or materials required.
Provide recommendations to management as to which projects are worthy of pursuing by recommending Project Concepts and scoring the projects.
Identify process improvement opportunities or initiatives to improve the client/customer experience.
Support prioritized Corporate initiatives in accordance with project timelines and allocated budget
Risk Management
Ensures compliance with established service objectives in accordance with procedures, corporate policies, legal guidelines, credit and lending policies, and applicable Federal and State Laws.
Support Commercial Trade and Letters of Credit Services audits/exams by providing requested information per agreed upon timeframes and ensure all requested responses for all exceptions or issues completed within the requested time frame.
Perform Quality Review of system designated activities.
Client Relations and Services Support
Collaborate and mitigate system risk by working with designated business lines and LTS ITS to obtain required documentation to ensure all requests are compliant.
Effectively communicate clear and detailed instructions needed for understanding system processes and procedures.
Resolve system customer escalated issues by providing appropriate instructions to Trade and Letters of Credit Operations and designated business lines.
Provide guidance and recommendations to external customers in relation to their system usage and capabilities to ensure policies and procedures are adhered to.

6 years of Mortgage Lending or Banking Industry experience
3 years of experience interacting with clients, relationship managers or lenders
3 years of experience with Microsoft Office Suite applications (i.e., Outlook, Word, and Excel)
2 years of experience of residential mortgage loan workflow or financial transaction systems
2 years of experience developing and executing projected related tasks OR 1 year experience managing and leading a project team(s)

About SVSU:
Saginaw Valley State University is a comprehensive university with more than 100 programs of study for its roughly 7,000 students. Located on a suburban campus in Michigan’s Great Lakes Bay Region, SVSU is committed to a supportive and empowering environment for students, faculty and staff. For eight consecutive years, SVSU has been recognized as a “Great College to Work For” (2016-2023).

SVSU emphasizes undergraduate teaching and learning, and community-based research. SVSU earned the Community Engagement classification from the Carnegie Foundation for the Advancement of Teaching, a distinction achieved by only 7 percent of U.S. colleges and universities. By their senior year, 84 percent of students have engaged with community employers and agencies in internships, field placements or some other component of their academic preparation.

SVSU is establishing itself as a leader in STEAM education for the Great Lakes Bay Region, partnering with businesses, foundations and school districts to improve students’ performance in math, science and the arts at the middle school, high school and university levels.

More than 70 percent of SVSU freshmen live on campus in student housing that has been rated No. 1 among public universities in the U.S. (2018-2023). SVSU fields 19 varsity sports at the NCAA Division II level. The average class size is 23 students.

HARMAN’s engineers and designers are creative, purposeful and agile. As part of this team, you’ll combine your technical expertise with innovative ideas to help drive cutting-edge solutions in the car, enterprise and connected ecosystem. Every day, you will push the boundaries of creative design, and HARMAN is committed to providing you with the opportunities, innovative technologies and resources to build a successful career.
A Career at HARMAN
As a technology leader that is rapidly on the move, HARMAN is filled with people who are focused on making life better. Innovation, inclusivity and teamwork are a part of our DNA. When you add that to the challenges we take on and solve together, you’ll discover that at HARMAN you can grow, make a difference and be proud of the work you do everyday.
About the Role
As an R&D Operations Analyst, you will be focused on ensuring the SBU has the data necessary to run the business in an effective way. You will create dashboards and reports that will be accessible to the teams you support. You will also analyze the data to find improvement opportunities and potentially lead activities to resolve issues. You will partner closely with HR and Finance business partners, as well as project, product, and engineering teams.

What You Will Do
You will work with your management team to derive and document best-in-class analytics to help the SBU run the business with consistently visible and accurate data.
Develop dashboards and reports to allow the management team to understand the status of people (staff levels, hiring status, etc.), budget information, project staffing, and relevant project information (e.g., feature development status, deliverables, defect reports, etc).
Direct responsibility for the CAB process (CAB coordination/process owner & superuser/led CAB meetings with Sr. Leadership)
Track and report on headcount, hiring, and expense status.
Evaluate the data to uncover areas for improvement and suggest strategies for developing and implementing solutions.
Lead ongoing reviews of business processes and develop optimization strategies.
Comfortable working in cross-functional teams (R&D, Finance, Purchasing, Manufacturing, Sales).
What You Need
A bachelor’s degree in business or related field or an MBA.
A minimum of 5 years of experience in business analysis or a related field.
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
Experience in analyzing data to draw business-relevant conclusions and in data visualization techniques and tools.
Advanced Excel, PowerPoint, and Analytics tools skills (such as QLIK, SAP, or other data visualization tools)
What Makes You Eligible
Be willing to travel up to 10%, domestic and international travel.
Be willing to work in an office in Novi MI
Successfully complete a background investigation and drug screen as a condition of employment

Flexible work environment, allowing for full-time remote work globally for positions that can be performed outside a HARMAN or customer location.
Access to employee discounts on world-class Harman and Samsung products (JBL, HARMAN Kardon, AKG, etc.)
Extensive training opportunities through our own HARMAN University
Competitive wellness benefits

Access to HARMAN Campus Fitness Center and Cafeteria

ABOUT US AND ABOUT YOU

Clinician Nexus enables health care organizations to build thriving clinician teams with industry-leading technology products, workforce and compensation analytics, and automated workflow solutions. Backed by extensive technical expertise and industry-leading data, we deliver innovative approaches to help clients to plan, educate, and engage their clinical workforce at every stage of the lifecycle. We are committed to providing our clients with outstanding guidance and support as they focus on shaping the future of health care.

The Business Systems Analyst sits within Clinician Nexus Customer Success. In this role, you will assist in analyzing client business requirements for the product, recommending automated system controls, and testing/validating product functionality.

PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITIES


Helping to determine operational objectives, gather information, and evaluate output requirements.
Working closely with end-users (internal and external) to analyze, define, model, and document system requirements.

Providing client support.

Position requires on-call and some weekend and after-hours commitment

Bachelor's degree in data analytics, statistics, or related field.
Knowledge of the health care industry and/or finance is preferred.
A minimum of one year of experience with gathering systems' requirements and analyzing data is required.
Solid technical knowledge and experience working with Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills.

BEHAVIORAL ATTRIBUTES

Ability to present ideas in a business-friendly and user-friendly language and respond to client and/or survey respondent inquiries.
Self-starter with demonstrated ability to successfully assist with complex project deliverables in a very driven and dynamic organization.
Demonstrated ownership of assigned tasks and dedication and perseverance to get the job done.
Flexibility, adaptability, and the ability to work under tight deadlines or changing needs.
Confidence and ability to work independently.
Exceptional employee service orientation.
Strong attention to detail.
High level of self-motivation.

Nurse Informaticist/Business Analyst - Ambulatory - Cerner

THE OPPORTUNITY

Total Systems Solutions Consulting Inc. https://totalsystems.ca is seeking a Nurse Informaticist/Business Analyst to work for our public sector client at the Island Health(IHealth) in the Province of British Columbia. This is a remote role and must be available 100% to work remote full-time 40 hours per week with availability Monday to Friday from 8:00am to 5:00pm in the Pacific Time Zone.

The consultant is expected to start date is December 11, 2023 and the contract length is 3 months.

Project Context

The details of Island Health’sIHealth project can be found here: https://ihealth.islandhealth.ca.

Island Health is continuing to progress the iHealth initiative by expanding the implementation of Computerized Provider Order Entry (CPOE) in tertiary sites, activating next in Victoria General Hospital (VGH) and Royal Jubilee Hospital (RJH).

The CPOE stream encompasses the implementation of guided electronic ordering for diagnostic tests (including laboratory testing, point of care testing), medications and specialist referrals.

The IHealth team and senior clinical and medical leaders have agreed that Victoria General Hospital (VGH) will go live in mid-February 2024 and Royal Jubilee Hospital (RJH) will go live in mid-March 2024 with computerized provider order entry (CPOE) and a “closed-loop” medication administration and management system. Gorge Road Health Centre (GRHC) and South Island Surgical Centre (SISC) will activate with VGH.

Service Required

Nurse Informaticists required to support the localization and implementation of 2 general medical ambulatory clinics (Liver Clinic and Medical Genetics clinic).
Supporting requirements gathering and design for clinical localization.
Engagements with clinical unit leaders, staff, and physicians in supporting completion of the work deliverables.
Creating end to end clinical workflows.
Completing requirements gathering to populate DCWs.
Creating and executing test scripts for functional testing of design as well as regression testing of end to end workflow.
Documenting JIRA Decision and Change tickets to execute design and build work as well as decisions required to route through clinical/project governance.
Using Service NOW to coordinate build work with relevant build teams through organizations technical change process.
Working with education team to inform and validate education content creation for activation

Consultant Qualifications

Skill Sets and Qualifications for Lab Informaticist Consultant:

Recent and relevant experience as Nurse Informaticist or Business Analyst in General Medical Ambulatory Clinics.
Relevant Cerner ambulatory experience with general medical ambulatory clinic design and implementation with a focus on end to end design.
Ability to engage with clinical staff and providers in a professional matter to elicit information and requirements to support:
workflow mapping
functional design (scheduling appointment books, quick orders pages, powerforms, dyndoc, position builds, orders to scheduling, etc.)
Ability to work with and develop/complete DCWs in collaboration with relevant partners in informatics and build teams.
Ability to create and execute functional and regression test scripts for clinics.
Ability to work independently and be self motivated as well as work as part of a larger diffuse team.
Ability to facilitate meetings and have excellent presentation skills.
Demonstrated problem-solving skills.
Ability to work in a fast paced environment, organizing workload and priorities.
Proficient use of excel, Visio, and PowerPoint.
Effective interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.
Ability to organize workload and priorities.
Must work PST Time and be available full time hours.
Experience working with CST Project in Vancouver, BC is a preferred asset, but not required.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $90.00 per hour

Schedule:

8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

ABOUT WHIRLPOOL CORPORATION
Whirlpool Corporation (NYSE: WHR) is committed to being the best global kitchen and laundry company, in constant pursuit of improving life at home. In an increasingly digital world, the company is driving purposeful innovation to meet the evolving needs of consumers through its iconic brand portfolio, including Whirlpool, KitchenAid, Maytag, Consul, Brastemp, Amana, Bauknecht, JennAir, Indesit, Yummly and InSinkErator. In 2022, the company reported approximately $20 billion in annual sales, 61,000 employees and 56 manufacturing and technology research centers. Additional information about the company can be found at WhirlpoolCorp.com.

This role in summary

The Corporate Strategy Business Development (CSBD) team is aligned with the C-suite at Whirlpool and drives initiatives in four major areas: Strategic Initiatives, Competitive Intelligence, Strategic Planning and Business Development, described here.


Strategic initiatives – The CSBD function leads important strategic initiatives mandated by the Board of Directors or the Executive Committee on behalf of the enterprise. We also partner with business leaders to support the development of business strategies. Types of initiatives we drive include market entry strategy, growth strategy, and portfolio strategy.


Competitive strategy & intelligence – CSBD partners with the Executive Committee to shape the competitive strategy for the company and embed it into regional plans. We assess competitor activities and performance, including being accountable for ongoing competitive monitoring.


Strategic planning – The CSBD team defines strategic planning for the enterprise, including long-range planning, strategic planning, and strategy reviews with the Board of Directors.


Business Development and Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A) – Responsible for the M&A strategy as well as an assessment of and execution of specific acquisition, joint venture, alliance, and divestiture opportunities on a global basis.

As an Analyst, Strategy & Business Development your responsibilities will include
Play a key analytic and synthesis role in strategic projects within Whirlpool’s core business as well as areas adjacent to major appliances (such as small domestic appliances, consumables, etc.)
Understand, structure, and analyze complex business issues
Prioritize analyses through hypothesis-based problem solving
Seek second-order implications and insights beyond the obvious, taking guidance from people leaders
Perform rigorous and accurate analysis and modeling of financial and other market research data
Translate analysis output into practical and implementable recommendations
Support the creation of Whirlpool’s competitive strategies and ongoing competitive intelligence gathering
Support business development/M&A actions including target screening/assessment, valuation, due diligence, and acquisition integration, on an as needed basis
Assess and profile companies to support both formulation and identification/execution of strategic partnership, joint venture, and acquisition opportunities
Communication development and business reporting:
Share insights and recommendations in a structured and easily digestible manner in both written and oral format, persuading based on facts and sound logic
Present analysis while engaging the audience and projecting self-assurance
Take an active role in internal and external presentations, meetings, discussions
Build a network of internal relationships with a broad cross-section of the organization, and leverage organizational knowledge, resources, and expertise
Manage own time and schedule with initiative and effectiveness, negotiating and prioritizing demands across multiple projects
Able to work partially remote (e.g. 1 day per week), coordinating and process-managing work in a virtual setting
Minimum requirements
Bachelor’s Degree completed or in progress with anticipated completion by Spring/Summer 2024 in Business, Finance, Economics, Strategy, or other analytical fields, including Engineering or Mathematics.
3+ months of experience in Business or Strategy (Experience may include internships, academic projects, co-op positions, or participation in academic clubs/extracurricular activities (such as Finance, Management Consulting, or Investment Banking clubs))
Preferred skills and experiences
Internship OR 1+ years of experience working in a management consulting firm, financial institution, or consumer goods business
Internship OR 1+ years of experience in Strategy, Finance, Accounting, Marketing or Operations in a corporate environment
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, both quantitative and qualitative
Excellent communications and presentation skills, both written and verbal, including confidence and presence to engage effectively with senior executives
Mastery of Google Slides and Google Sheets
Ability to recognize the accomplishments of the team before the individual
Highly motivated and possess vision and enthusiasm
Understand how to deliver on short time frames and be committed to meeting deadlines
Communicate in an open and honest way that quickly builds trust and respect
Possess an entrepreneurial spirit
Be comfortable making presentations

RSRWH

Additional information

Whirlpool’s Ways of Working
Our goal is to provide an environment that helps you bring your best to Whirlpool every day. We apply ‘always on’ flexibility to all work days. You will have the autonomy to manage personal, family, and outside-of-work commitments as needed. Employees in this role work in person Monday through Thursday with the option to work remotely on Friday.


We offer other flexibility and industry-leading time-off benefits that will help you balance what’s important at work and at home, including:

We are global, we are impacting the lives of millions every day, we are making a difference!
At Amcor we are inspired to change the packaging industry and are taking on the aspirational challenge to make all our products recyclable or reusable by 2025. Through our products and global footprint, we are in a unique position to truly make a difference in the packaging space. Our products impact the lives of millions of people across the globe every day from food, beverage, pharmaceutical, medical, home- and personal-care, and other essential products. Amcor is a thriving S&P 500 organisation listed both on the NYSE (AMCR) and ASX (AMC) with US$13 billion in sales. We have a proud history dating back to the 1860’s and come a long way from a single paper mill based in Melbourne to becoming the global leading packaging company. Today, Amcor is an international organisation empowering its 50,000 employees in over 40 countries and across 250 sites.

Will you be next to join our journey towards a more sustainable future? At Amcor we are always looking for talented and passionate individuals who are motivated to make a difference. Working at Amcor means you will have a unique opportunity to be a part of an organisation that is committed to providing sustainable packaging solutions. To find out more about our commitment to sustainability and about Amcor, visit

Job Description
Position Overview:
Collaborate with Procurement Excellence Manager and other Category Leaders on various procurement initiatives and special projects. Conduct complex analytics including cost modelling, industry/market analysis, financial statement reviews, benchmarking, and evaluations of multiple quotations for purchase of goods/services to drive value creation and best-in-class Procurement capabilities. Help in the identification of opportunities to continuously reduce the total cost of ownership (TCO) and secure supply for assigned commodity/category. In conjunction with the category/commodity team and other cross functional partners assist in driving best performance for a set of commodities/categories in line with Amcor’s strategic objectives and assuring compliance with customer related and regulatory requirements regarding the Amcor supply base.
Essential Responsibilities and Duties:
Key Duties/Responsibilities:
Gather and analyze key business metrics using data collection techniques (e.g., downloading of transactional data to spreadsheet format) to recommend and report results to Senior Management to be used in the business plan and strategy development.
Extract, analyze and report SAP and other system data to improve procurement/supply chain efficiencies using company sponsored (internal/external) applications
Synthesize data, generate actionable insights, and identify opportunities through operational and financial analysis to drive positive financial impacts to organization
Analyze business data utilizing various data analysis tools including advanced excel techniques and applicable coding methods to generate actionable insights
Maintain and update key reports for use in general communications and internal/external stakeholder inquiries to facilitate accurate volume – related transactions & reporting
Lead and assist in the development of cost models, data collection and measurements to provide guidance regarding product performance, services, and “should cost” modelling
Position will ensure management team receive summaries of key data collected and insights gained from analysis completed. Play a key role in the development of predictive category forecasting capabilities, long-term strategies and in supplier negotiations (annual and multi-year agreements)
Position will be responsible for collecting and verifying the accuracy of data used in the development and implementation of complex models and decision frameworks. In completing this work, the position will develop creative techniques to improve collection and verification of the data and then expected to document and share best practices across organization.
Support the business by reviewing and approving purchasing requisitions, ensuring best practices are followed and creating / managing metrics to document process efficiency and compliance
Technical Skills:
Customer Focus: Making customers (external and internal) and their needs a primary focus of one's actions; developing and sustaining productive customer relationships; creating and executing plans and solutions in collaboration with the customer
Data Extraction: Ability to extract and query data from multiple systems (e.g., SAP, GSTT, GSDB, etc.)
Data Validation / Clean Up: Knowledge of and ability to understand and resolve data inconsistencies or variances and employ effective methods to correct.
Data Analytics: Utilize a variety of techniques including advanced excel modelling, applicable coding methods (i.e. python), and dataset manipulation to derive critical insights and support decision making.
Information Systems: Knowledge and use of existing Technical Information Systems (e.g. SAP, GSTT etc.) to generate necessary data; Ability to access, analyze and use information in a manner that adds value to the organization; Ability to propose system enhancements based upon business needs
Monitoring, Measurement and Metrics: Knowledge of key business drivers or measures used to gauge the effectiveness and performance of an internal group or a supplier; Ability to determine appropriate measures or metrics; Ability to measure against those standards; Ability to communicate performance standards and metrics
Record Retention: Knowledge of the policies and procedures for storing and retaining financial, non-financial and company documents
Requirements Planning: Knowledge of how to plan materials and service requirements to support ongoing business
Software Applications: Knowledge and use of technical software applications. coding languages, and data visualization (i.e. Power BI) appropriate to the specific work activities
Strong computer skills, including knowledge of SAP systems; Advanced Excel skills, strong skills in PowerPoint, Word, and Access.
Develop a working knowledge of commodities being purchased to create should cost models.
Strategy:
Assist in the optimization on total cost of ownership by leveraging fact-based elements, i.e. supplier price breakdowns, including processing cost obtained either through internal calculations, external benchmarking, market driven pricing, etc. to support the assigned commodity/category strategy execution to meet ProcurePlus business objectives.
Assist in the definition, collaboration and execution of the negotiation strategy, negotiation schedule and supplier selection criteria to support the assigned commodity/category strategy execution to meet ProcurePlus business objectives.
Assist in strategy review and adjustment in line with Amcor’s strategies and ProcurePlus business objectives.
Assist in identification of supply risks to supply/cost and develop plans to mitigate risks.
Supplier selection, approval and management:
Assisting the identification, evaluation and the approval process of new suppliers that meet Amcor performance standards and compliance requirements.
Assist in leveraging current supply base through supplier relationship management (SRM) process or identify new suppliers to support new product launches / initiatives.
Assist in development of Global/Regional Contracts and/or Make vs Buy Refresh cycle or outsourcing opportunities.
Pricing & Cost:
Understand the market(s) well enough to know who the leaders in pricing, technology and service are and drive to the lowest possible total cost of ownership (TCO)
Work with Functional, Engineering, Operations, Commodity/category Managers, Sourcing functions, Logistics and the supply base to develop target cost and low-cost alternatives. Understand all the components of related costs to know where opportunities exist that need to be addressed. Regularly organize and conduct pricing benchmarks, competitive analysis.
Utilize, develop a broad skill set of RFQ, Benchmarking and negotiation methodologies. Continuously improve staff technical, commercial and negotiation capabilities to ensure versatility in supplier meetings.
Drive commodity / category-level improvement programs on cost, quality excellence, and supply chain at suppliers. Develop and maintain a portfolio of cost saving projects that meet Amcor targets for spend cost reduction.
Charter supplier negotiation and lead/participate the negotiation with appointed teams. Negotiate agreements that address the global needs of Amcor including, but not limited to price, delivery, quality and other required services. Lead negotiation with industry benchmarks / pricing targets / data (fact-based negotiations) and knowledge sharing. Responsible for provision of commercial sourcing expertise to all functional budget holders.
Drive standardization (processes, design, requirements, specifications)
Conduct various buying analyses and spend evaluations on an on-going basis.
Full utilization of Sourcing and RFx and eProcurement tools, such as E-Auctions, Catalogues, etc.
Ensure maximum leverage through consolidation of entity, region, division, and global demand.
Supply Base Development & Management:
Assist in the identification of non-preferred spend to help drive the efforts to move business away from suppliers that are not preferred
Monitor key KPIs to assess and rate risk regularly and assist in Business Continuity Planning (BCP) efforts
Assist in driving IT integration with key suppliers to automate transactions and communication. Collaborate with Category Leaders on Amcor’s Digital Procurement journey.
Compliance:
Always ensure the Supply Base and Amcor procurement operates within the framework of regulatory and legal requirements. These include but are not limited to compliance with Safety, Environmental, SOX, Tax, Customs and Ethical requirements and spend guidelines.
Gain understanding and acceptance of respective documents, such as the Amcor Code of Conduct, Amcor Terms and Conditions and cover any other requirements
Actively support integration of procurement systems and tools, i.e. P2P, to improve business performance. Identify and communicate all system and process gaps to ensure sustainability of ProcurePlus value creation and capability development.
Qualifications & Experience:
Bachelor’s degree: Business, Finance, Operations Research, Data/Decision Sciences, Industrial Engineering, Supply Chain, or Logistics
Master’s degree: Desired
Certification(s) Preferred: C.P.M., CPSM, CPSD, CPIM, CSCP, PMP
Other education: Six Sigma, Should Cost Modeling, Change Management, Project Management Languages: English (written and spoken fluently) required
Spanish and/or Portuguese Preferred (depending on position)
5+ years of demonstrated business analysis and reporting experience in manufacturing focused organizations
SAP ECC, MII proficiency
Relationships:
Build strong rapport with suppliers to position ARP as a preferred and trusted business partner and ensure an uninterrupted supply of quality goods at optimum cost.
Work closely with buyers at Amcor plants and category managers/leaders to establish alignment with strategy and enable changes necessary to drive improvements.
Collaborate closely with relevant departments including engineering and plant operations to ensure understanding and compliance with key procurement strategies

POSITION DESCRIPTION:




The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst Lead works on a fast-paced, innovative team in the Business Intelligence Department to enable the use of actionable data by IHA business units. This is a highly versatile role at the intersection of people and technology, requiring the ability to explain and translate business requirements into technical specifications. BI Analysts collaborate with all areas of IHA Medical Group including administrative departments, specialty divisions and executive leaders to understand goals to deliver vital information to support data-informed decision-making. The BI Analyst’s role in data projects includes gathering requirements, working with developers to integrate and transform data, working with customers to validate results, and creating powerful interactive visualizations in the form of dashboards, reports, and presentations.

The BI Analyst contributes to the process of modeling, building, validating and documenting enterprise data. Uses statistics, machine learning and other data analysis techniques to provide relevant and useful data findings.




ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

Serves as lead to implement and support major organizational business intelligence initiatives.
Creates and supports complex interactive visualizations, automated reports and ad hoc analyses using tools such as PowerBI, Azure Fabric, Tableau and SSRS.
Creates and maintains self-service data marts for end-users using SSAS Tabular model and assesses overall improvements and best practices for a superior user experience, focusing on decreasing technical burden on patient-facing staff, and executive leadership.
Evaluates emerging technologies to determine how new capabilities can assist the organization in supporting organizational initiatives.
Helps team advance on plans for use of artificial intelligence, including Natural Language Processing, ChatGPT, predictive analytics, and leveraging machine learning to find hidden insights in data.
Provides essential and timely information to executive leadership and presents often to all levels at IHA.
Clearly describes report specifications and maintains a catalog of easy-to-understand data definitions.
Mentors teammates to learn new skills by delegating and supervising work. Proactively seeks feedback on self and team while striving to deliver solutions that exceed customer expectations.
Leads efforts to transform the organization into a data-driven organization.
Enables self-service analytics through implementation of tools and training of non-technical staff on use of data and reports. Ensures data structure allows full self-service analytics while minimizing accidental misuse of data.
Develops and maintains role-based security of data access through self-service analytic tools to comply with data security standards.
Answers analytic questions to support data-driven decision making using multiple data sources including clinical, financial, payer claims, benchmarking and other healthcare data.
Creates reporting and presentations using data that can easily be interpreted by non-technical staff.
Engages with organizational leadership, staff and providers to translate project data needs into BI/DW requirements, serving as both a functional and technical expert and making recommendations about data delivery methods.
Design and monitor end-user reporting tools and systems, ensuring reports are accurate and up-to-date. Develops processes to automate data testing to ensure data quality.
Supervises interns or temporary staff as needed.



ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS:

EDUCATION: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and relevant experience. Preferred field of study in data science, computer science, healthcare administration, public health, or finance. Master’s degree preferred.




CREDENTIALS/LICENSURE: N/A

MINIMUM EXPERIENCE: 5+ years’ data analysis experience required; healthcare and/or financial analytics experience preferred.




POSITION REQUIREMENTS (ABILITIES & SKILLS):

Analytic skills and experience in presenting complex analyses to organizational leadership to drive decision making.
Demonstrated expert level SQL coding skills to query and join complex data sets. Strong understanding of and ability to utilize stored procedures and SSIS packages.
Experience with one or more aspects of artificial intelligence such as: advanced analytics, machine learning, predictive analytics, natural language processing, chatgpt, or augmented analytics tools.
Expert level knowledge of relational or dimensional databases as used in SSAS Tabular models, Power BI data models, or equivalent market products.
Understands data governance principles, master data management, role-based security, and data quality principles. Experience successfully implementing Microsoft SQL Server Data Quality Services and/or Master Data Services (or similar software) is desirable.
Experience designing, developing and maintaining SQL Server tabular models to support cross-functional business reporting objectives and enable self-service analytics.
Ability to serve as project lead to implement and provide solutions support to major organizational business intelligence initiatives by understanding high-level functional and technical requirements, managing development, and setting and meeting deadlines.
Proficient in operating a standard desktop and Windows-based computer system, including but not limited to, information systems software, Microsoft Word and Excel (expert-level), data analytic and reporting tools, including query tools (SQL Server Management Studio, SQL Developer, Access, etc.), and interactive business intelligence products (Tableau, Power BI), intranet and computer navigation. Ability to use other software as required while performing the essential functions of the job.
Excellent communication skills in both written and verbal forms. Ability to speak before groups of people, either in-person or virtually, and apply consultative skills to work effectively within assigned areas of the organization.
Broad knowledge of healthcare industry, including ability to cross-walk clinical, operational, financial, claims and quality data from EHR/EMR and general ledger systems. Broad knowledge of standard medical codesets (ICD, CPT), performance measurement (quality, cost and utilization metrics), financial and billing data.
Familiarity with front-end workflows and reporting from multiple Electronic Medical Record (EMR) systems, such as Epic, NextGen and Athena.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
Ability to work effectively with various levels of organizational members and diverse populations including IHA Divisional leadership, staff, providers, patients, vendors, outside customers, hospitals and community groups.
Good organizational and time management skills to effectively juggle multiple priorities and meet deadlines.
Demonstrated ability to exercise sound judgement, trouble-shooting and problem-solving skills, i.e., reporting error and identifying solutions to correct issues.
Ability to handle patient and organizational information in a confidential manner.
Ability to drive to other office/practice sites and meeting and training locations.
Successful completion of IHA competency-based program within introductory and training period.

Bring your owner’s mindset and play a critical role to support the efficiency of the operations team. In this role, you will work cross functionally to play a critical part in ensuring that our Master Data is certified, reliable, and easily accessible. This creates a strong foundation for agile analytics to harvest insights, which drive sustainable growth and profit. Your attention to detail, and pride for systems and data integrity will make you a great fit for our company and is a key ingredient to your success.

A Taste of What You’ll Be Doing

Master Data Expertise- We are looking for someone who has a passion for data accuracy! Leveraging your strong attention to detail, you will be responsible for managing Master Data in SAP relative to all aspects of product and customer hierarchy setup and maintenance. Through accurate and timely setup and rapidly changing priorities, you will enable and maximize business effectiveness across the company. Examples of this type of work includes (but is not limited to): Updating customer/product hierarchy, creating source files, updating payment terms, shipping locations
Influencing Systems Consistency and Accuracy- You will be a significant contributor to ensuring our data requirements are met. Understanding WinShuttle, SAP and digital concierge and other technical capabilities will enable the team to drive fast, accurate setup. This position is heavily relied on to meet all aspects of SOX 404 requirements.
Communication – You will work closely with your teammates to ensure your success. Through effective communication and collaboration, you will be adding value to ensure we meet our business goals.

Your Recipe for Success

Bachelor’s Degree with some related work experience
Experience focused on business and systems related to SAP Master Data
Strong attention for detail
Strong verbal and written communication skills to convey complex and detailed information to different audiences.
Experience in the Data Governance space
Systems knowledge in technologies such as SAP, Winshuttle and Excel

Job Title: Customs Data Analyst – Automation / Canadian Operations
Job Description:
We are the movers of the world and the makers of the future. We get up every day, roll up our sleeves and build a better world - together. At Ford, we’re all a part of something bigger than ourselves. What will you make today?

Ford Motor Company operates a worldwide manufacturing and distribution network in over 150 countries that requires the cross-border movement of parts and vehicles. Automation and operational direct management are necessary, for all Ford materials and shipments. As part of our team, you will contribute to the movement of these parts and vehicles, helping us continue to build the world-class, state-of-the-art smart vehicles we're known for.

In this position...

You will manage the roll-out and ongoing maintenance of automated customs filing systems and support our Canadian customs operations, as an integral part of the Global Customs Strategy.

What you'll do...

Manage the de-risking of Ford’s customs compliance space by combining the systems side of the Customs practice with cross-border operational excellence
Lead the launch of our customs interface systems
Manage the post-launch operational activities within the customs operational team.

You'll have...

Bachelors degree
3+ Years of Experience

Even better, you may have...

Experience in Customs system roll-outs and/or maintenance of Global Trade Management (GTM) software
Experience in Canadian customs cross-border operations and customs regulations
Knowledge of how to coordinate Canadian business/IT requirements for a Customs Compliance function
Prior involvement in testing of GTM solutions / Business requirements
Experience developing data analytics tools to identify process improvement opportunities within large and complex customs datasets
Experience with both Legacy and modern software platforms
Familiarity with software/systems transitions
Supported the development of Customs metrics based on documentation of proper data safe sources
Fluency in Spanish or other second languages

Immediate medical, dental, and prescription drug coverage

Tuition assistance

Paid time off and the option to purchase additional vacation time.

Senior Business Intelligence Analyst

Context

The shift within Higher Education more from one-time purchases of print textbooks to recurring subscriptions of digital products has generated a wealth of data about our products, customers, opportunities, and sales.

We’re looking for a leader who can take this information and leverage the latest data analytics tools, especially Tableau, to provide insight into the performance of business.

Reporting to the Director of Business Intelligence and sitting within the Strategic Sales Operations wing of US Higher Ed Sales Operations, the Sr Business Intelligence Analyst leads the analyses of the sales pipeline, net sales, subscriptions, and market data across multiple formats, models, and channels.

Responsibilities

Forecasting Mastery: Take the helm in owning all aspects of forecasting seasonal revenue, turning data into a strategic asset for our team.
Collaborative Insight: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, finance, and product, to deliver accessible and consumable insights into the success of our higher education products.
Dashboard Stewardship: Support the lifecycle of our Tableau dashboards, ensuring they remain up to date with the latest features and capabilities while streamlining and retiring those that are no longer necessary.
Analytical Evolution : Drive the evolution of our analytics capabilities from self-service to predictive and early alert insights into product, sales, and market trends.
Data Integrity Guardian : Manage functional areas of data management, forecasting, contacts, leads, opportunities, dashboards, and reports, ensuring data integrity across our systems.
Strategic Partner: Assist in turning sales data into actionable insights that inform our go=to-market strategy, emphasizing focus areas, maximizing revenue, and preventing revenue leakage.

Essential Skills:

Holistic Business Understanding: Detailed comprehension of the sales business process and the ability to translate business needs into technical specifications.
Communication Prowess: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex topics and present them thoughtfully to senior leaders.
Tech Savvy: Comfort with navigating the complexity of data across legacy and third-party platforms, ensuring forward momentum while simplifying and standardizing.
Organizational Agility : Strong time-management and organizational skills to balance multiple competing priorities.
Data Expertise: Background with ETL logic, data modeling concepts, and 5+ years of experience in a technical data role.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, or computer-related program
5+ years of experience in a technical data role, such as analyst, engineer, architect, or scientist 5
5+ years of experience with multiple versions of SQL
5+ years of experience building and maintaining Tableau dashboards

Preferred Skills

Proficiency with Salesforce Sales Cloud (Marketing & Services Clouds a plus)
Proficiency with cloud databases such as Google BigQuery or Snowflake
Experience with machine learning concepts such as predictive modeling, categorization, and clustering
Background with programming in a language such as R or Python
Experience working in or supporting Sales or Revenue Operations a plus

Support to Operations Finance to have timely and accurate calculation and reporting of financial result of the plant. Help improve the performance of the Plant by identifying the GAPs towards the financial targets.




Role Summary
(Entry level position) Provides support to Operations Finance to have timely and accurate calculation and reporting of financial result of the plant. Helps improve the performance of the Plant by identifying the GAPs towards the financial targets. This role is located in Van Buren, AR.




Detailed Responsibilities





• Support X+1 budget and cost price calculation

In partnership with the Manager, collect all necessary data to prepare and calculate X+1 budget and assists in preparing the financial plan of the plant
Discusses X+1 norms and standards with departmental management
Manages the CO master data and the standard cost prices for all the materials to have accurate margin analysis.
Analyse standard cost and communicate cost fluctuations within related functions within internal departments
Responsible for analysing and detecting critical parameters of the production process that can have an impact on the company result
Performance indicators: Calculation of X+1 Budget and standard cost prices



Support a winning business portfolio
Running a report on a systematic basis: expenses, cost data, inventories, recharges.
Assists management in calculating the efficient use of production means and systems; budgets and ensures follow-up of overheads
Improve the cash conversion costs, by updating performance dashboards on critical topics and reports to departmental management and Operations Finance (Controller)
Collects, analyses and reports on ad hoc questions about financials and cost information to departmental management and Operations Finance (Controller)
Checks expenses of the department and inter-departmental transfers
Coordinates and follows up on timely registration of use of BOM items and cash cost elements.
Monitors the financial procedures to ensure that systems and internal controls within the plant meet the needs of management and ensures that financial activities comply with applicable group rules.
Performance indicators: Identify the GAPs towards the financial targets and report to departmental management/Operations Finance (Controller)



Support management by analysing the effective use of resources and systems.
Monitors the working capital and proposes actions to meet the targets



Support Periodic closing and reporting
Safeguard the accuracy of the costs booked on the cost centers and set up accruals if needed
Checks valorisation of sales and perform sales margin analysis
Valorisation of stock, both monthly and at year end, including coordination of internal audits
Follow up on scrap/reject figures and review inventory correction postings
Analyses all variances on the different cost centers and reports to departmental management/ Operations Finance (Controller)
Prepares all necessary follow up reports to report on the performance of the plant related costs to departmental management
Supplies data for and assists in consolidation reporting
Performance indicators: Assist in timely reporting of accurate plant result. All necessary reports are updated in time and in good quality



Support Investment analysis/ BMS saving projects



Supports in checking the correctness of the tangible assets, including tags
Assists in the evaluation of current investment files.
Cooperates in related projects and studies.
Support in checking the correct calculation of BMS savings projects



IT Support
Assist in checking the correct SAP flows



Key Relationships

Internal: Business Stakeholders & Site Operational Management,
External: Local Regulatory authorities including Tax and External auditors.



Leadership Competencies

Build a joint, bold ambition for our customers and markets
Provide direction, focus and navigate ambiguity
Champion change and foster innovation
Inspire others, engage and communicate with impact
Develop strong, diverse teams and talent
Lead by example and create emotional attachment
Deliver sustainable high performance
Hold self and others accountable



Functional Skills

Associates or Bachelors degree in Accounting or Finance required
Accounting acumen (IFRS, relevant/local GAAP),
Business acumen
Knowledge of local tax and tax accounting processes and requirements
Identifying key finance risks, general ledger accounting, balance sheet controls,
Process excellence and continuous improvement
Analytical Thinking and Analysis
Budgeting & forecasting
Technology Savvy (SAP essentials, MS Office, MS Teams, SharePoint)
Verbal and written proficiency in English

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Data Collection: Seek out and extract data using the correct methods that is both relevant and accurate to the task at hand.
Data Management: Ensuring the availability, accuracy, and reliability of data used for BI purposes. This may involve data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes.
Documentation: Document the information that is to be processed in an efficient manner.
Data Analysis: Supervising the analysis of data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can be used to make informed business decisions.
Reporting and Dashboards: Overseeing the creation and maintenance of reports, dashboards, and data visualizations to communicate critical information to various stakeholders.
BI Tools and Technologies: Help manage the selection, implementation, and maintenance of BI tools and technologies such as data warehouses, data visualization software, and analytics platforms.
Strategy Development: Work with the department leader to help developing and implementing a BI strategy that aligns with the organization's business goals and objectives.
Reporting: Create reports for team members and other departments as requested in both an accurate and timely manner.
Stakeholder Communication: Collaborating with department leaders and other departments to understand their data and reporting needs, and ensuring that the BI team provides actionable insights to support decision-making.
Data Security and Compliance: Ensuring that data is handled securely and in compliance with relevant data privacy regulations.
Continuous Improvement: Identifying opportunities for process improvements and staying up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in BI to keep the organization competitive.
Metrics: meet or exceed all designated Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) on a monthly basis.
All other duties as assigned
Desired Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Data Science, Computer Science).
Proven experience in business intelligence, data analytics, and data management.
Strong leadership skills.
Proficiency in BI tools and technologies (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, etc.).
Experience with data warehousing, ETL processes, and data modeling.
Excellent data analysis and data visualization skills.
Knowledge of database systems and SQL.
Familiarity with data privacy regulations and compliance.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to translate complex data into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.

This Team Member will be primarily responsible for supporting the Sales teams to drive Dawn’s Sales Operations initiatives. This position will support national initiatives while supporting adoption for Key and/or Market sales teams. Focus areas to support are:

JOB DESCRIPTION
Job Title: Business Analyst

Job Type: Full-time

Company Description:

Our client is a dynamic and rapidly growing manufacturing organization dedicated to providing innovative solutions to our clients. We are seeking a talented and motivated Business Analyst to join our team. This role requires a strong background in finance, expertise in Microsoft Dynamics 365 (D365), and proficiency in Power BI. If you are passionate about leveraging technology to drive financial insights and enhance business performance, we want to hear from you.

Business Analyst Job Summary:

As a Business Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in optimizing financial processes, analyzing data, and providing actionable insights to support strategic decision-making. Your primary responsibilities will include working with financial data, utilizing D365 for financial analysis and reporting, and leveraging Power BI to create visually engaging and informative dashboards. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to drive improvements in financial operations and contribute to the overall success of the organization.

Key Responsibilities of the Business Analyst:

Utilize Microsoft Dynamics 365 (D365) to extract, transform, and analyze financial data.
Develop and maintain financial models to support forecasting, budgeting, and financial planning.
Create interactive and visually appealing reports and dashboards using Power BI to communicate key financial metrics.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and understand business requirements for financial analysis and reporting.
Perform variance analysis, trend analysis, and financial performance evaluations to identify opportunities for improvement.
Conduct ad-hoc financial analysis as requested by senior management.
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency in financial reporting.
Stay current with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in finance and data analytics.
Provide training and support to end-users on D365 and Power BI functionalities.
Participate in cross-functional teams and contribute to strategic financial projects.
Identify opportunities for process improvements and automation in financial workflows.

Qualifications needed for Business Analyst:

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Financial Analyst or similar role.
Proficiency in Microsoft Dynamics 365 (D365) for Finance and Operations.
Strong expertise in Power BI for creating interactive reports and dashboards.
Solid understanding of financial principles, accounting standards, and financial reporting.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong attention to detail and data accuracy.
Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team.
Prior experience in the financial services industry is a plus.
Relevant certifications in D365 and Power BI are a strong asset.

Benefits:

Competitive salary commensurate with experience.
Comprehensive benefits package, including health, dental, and retirement plans.
Opportunities for career growth and development.
A collaborative and innovative work environment.
Access to cutting-edge financial technologies and tools.

If you are a proactive and results-driven Financial Business Analyst with a passion for leveraging D365 and Power BI to drive financial insights, we invite you to apply.

Colson Group USA is an operating unit of Colson Group the largest manufacturer of caster and wheel products in the world. Colson Group's unique and proprietary global footprint provides available services and capabilities unmatched by any other manufacturer.

Colson Group is in the process of upgrading its supply chain processes and systems. The Supply Chain Operations Analyst will primarily be responsible for maintaining, improving and developing critical supply chain processes. This role will be at the center of executing and providing input for the development of the group supply chain strategy.



ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

Full ownership of supply chain processes. Responsible for ensuring network compliance and process optimization to drive efficiencies.
Work cross functionally with peer organizations to identify and prioritize cost saving opportunities.
Support and lead projects focused on cost savings and upgraded customer experience.
Stakeholder management across all levels and departments including the office of the CEO.
Responsible for maintaining, developing and interpreting standard reporting.
Strong desire to progress in the organization. This job opening is positioned well with high visibility throughout the organization.
Multiple openings with a wide variety of needs including but not limited to: distribution, supply chain planning, transportation, etc.
Abide by all Colson policies and procedures.
All other duties as assigned.



SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, AND EXPERIENCE:

3-5 years of full-time work experience ideal. Bachelor’s degree in operations, engineering, supply chain or related field required.
Prior supply chain process management and optimization experience preferred. Preferably in a corporate setting but all process management experience considered.
Ability to influence other not in their direct reporting line to produce results.
Experience managing a wide variety of stakeholder and aligning various groups to a single vision.
Results oriented and analytical individual with experience of working with large, incomplete/inconsistent data sets. Able to recognize inconsistencies/oddities in data and act to correct them.
Well organized, proactive, independent, team player, keen to progress.
Able to prioritize and work to deadlines. Able to clearly communicate and align priorities with others.
Experience of working with ERP systems. EPICOR a plus but not required.
Experience of working with databases and data visualization tools. Excel experience required and Qlik a plus.
Ability to travel up to 25% of the time. Role located at a major operations center either in Southwest MI or Jonesboro, AR. Partial work from home considered.

Business Process Owner

Business Process Owner | The Shyft Group (TSG) | Novi, MI

Regular Employee | Salary Exempt

Who we are

At The Shyft Group we are driven to deliver, and as the North American leader in specialty vehicles, our portfolio of last-mile delivery vehicles, work trucks, and motorhome chassis brings people, goods, and services where they need to be.

We are strengthened by nine industry-leading brands - Utilimaster®, Blue Arc™ EV Solutions, Royal® Truck Body, DuraMag®, Magnum®, Strobes-R-Us®, Spartan® RV Chassis, Red Diamond™, and Builtmore™. Over 4,000 employees across ten states and two countries work independently and together as one team under Shyft, building chassis, vehicle bodies, and accessories that improve every route, every run, and every ride.

Empowered by a supportive, inclusive, and highly entrepreneurial culture, every person behind our brands is given the tools they need to make a positive contribution to the company, their community, and their families. Together under the Shyft umbrella, our teams drive new synergies that bring innovations to life on the road - for an experience that is safer, more satisfying, more rewarding all around.

With 50 years
and
and millions of miles behind us, we continue to charge forward

leading the commercial vehicle transition to electric, innovating across all our brands, and earning our position among
Fortune's
100 Fastest Growing Companies.

What you'll do

As the Business Process
Owner, Finance based at our headquarters in Novi, MI, you will be accountable for developing and implementing a standard finance model in tandem with our ERP implementation group, assisting them in establishing processes, validating and testing, and supplying user training and assistance.

In addition, you will spearhead a variety high-impact finance process improvement initiatives across the enterprise as your career progresses. By optimizing workflows and systems alignment for AP/AR, General Ledger, and more, you will be instrumental in driving increased efficiency and scalability as we grow.

You will also be responsible for:

Providing finance system subject matter expertise in areas of AP/AR, General Ledger, Invoicing, Costing, Intercompany, Expense Reporting, and Bank Recompilation
Partnering with location stakeholders to examine their core finance requirements and processes
Identifying commonalities and standardizing at least 80% of core finance processes across all locations
Developing a common finance model that aligns with the new ERP system implementation
Examining where there are process flow gaps and misalignments across locations
Attending weekly project team meetings and taking part in discovery sessions at each location
Thoroughly documenting the current state processes for each finance function (AP, AR, GL)
Preparing and reviewing procedures to develop a common finance model
Producing detailed documentation that outlines ERP system and process requirements
Coordinating a successful handoff of knowledge and ownership of the new ERP system
Collaborating with SMEs to establish and implement procedures to support the ERP implementation
Attending product training and eLearning sessions and participating in functional prototyping sessions
Managing all data conversion and validation plans
Facilitating and driving stage gate review sessions to gain acceptance and agreement
Providing status reports and additional documentation for the ERP implementation project
Overseeing the ERP team's activities, identifying problems, and initiating corrective measures
Presenting ideas for finance system and process improvements, including cost proposals
Preparing training manuals for new users
Maintaining the new finance systems once they are up and running
Traveling approximately 25% to 50% (based on the location being implemented) alternating between site locations and working remotely

Learn more about The Shyft Group and our brands by exploring the Learn More section below.

What you need to be successful

Bachelor's degree and 7+ years of business analysis or finance experience, OR equivalent combination of education and business analyst and finance experience
2 + years of Plex experience
Working knowledge of finance principles, theories, concepts, and best practices
Robust communication, interpersonal, organizational, problem-solving, and analytical skills
A reputation for being attentive to details and focused on continuous improvement
Versatility and flexibility to work within constantly changing priorities
A track record of planning and handling multiple tasks simultaneously while meeting deadlines
Versed in conducting research on project-related issues and products
Willingness and ability to travel up to 25-50% domestically

Job Summary:
The Detroit Tigers are currently seeking a full-time Analyst in the Baseball Operations Department. This role will be responsible for performing analyses and conducting research within Baseball Operations. This position will report to the Director, Baseball Analytics.
Key Responsibilities:
Perform advanced quantitative analysis to improve Baseball Operations decision-making, including predictive modeling and player projection systems.
Complete ad hoc data queries and effectively present analysis using written reports and data visualizations.
Assist with the integration of baseball analysis into our proprietary tools and applications.
Provide evaluations of players at various levels of competition, from high school to MLB.
Support the current data warehousing process within Baseball Operations.
Monitor, identify and recommend new or emerging techniques, technologies, models, and algorithms.
Other projects as directed by Baseball Operations leadership team.
Minimum Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Demonstrated expert-level knowledge of baseball-specific data, modern statistical techniques, and sabermetric analysis.
Relevant work experience with statistical software (R, STATA, SPSS, SAS, or similar) and scripting languages such as Python.
Expertise with SQL and relational databases is required.
Demonstrated ability to communicate difficult and complex concepts to colleagues possessing a wide range of backgrounds and perspectives.
Degree or equivalent experience in statistics, mathematics, computer science, or a related quantitative field.
Master’s degree preferred. At least one year of professional experience working with baseball data strongly preferred.
Self-starter.
Team player.
Ability to work evenings, weekends and holidays as dictated by the baseball calendar.
Willing and able to relocate to the Detroit metro area.
Working Conditions:
Office environment
Evening, weekend, and holiday hours required
All items listed above are illustrative and not comprehensive. They are not contractual in nature and are subject to change at the discretion of Detroit Tigers.
